help.short: The name of the NetApp account
The name of the capacity pool
The name of the volume

json.schema:
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="destinationReplications" identifiers="resourceId">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="dataStoreResourceId">
<prop type="array" name="rules" identifiers="ruleIndex">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="mountTargets" identifiers="fileSystemId">
<prop type="array" name="placementRules" identifiers="key">
<prop type="array" name="protocolTypes">
<prop type="array" name="zones">

command.name: delete
command.confirmation: Are you sure you want to perform this operation?

help.short: The name of the NetApp account
The name of the capacity pool
The name of the volume
An option to force delete the volume. Will cleanup resources connected to the particular volume

command.name: create

help.short: The name of the NetApp account
The name of the capacity pool
The name of the volume
Backup Policy Resource ID
Backup Vault Resource ID
Policy Enforced

Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'
The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

command.argGroup:
<arg type="array" var="$body.properties.placementRules" options="placement-rules" group="Properties">
<arg type="array" var="$body.properties.protocolTypes" options="protocol-types" group="Properties">

help.short: The Path to a ONTAP Host
The name of a server on the ONTAP Host
The name of a volume on the server
Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication
The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.
The resource ID of the remote volume.
Snapshot Policy ResourceId
Has relocation been requested for this volume

json.schema:
<prop type="array" name="rules" arg="$body.properties.exportPolicy.rules" identifiers="ruleIndex">
<prop type="array" name="placementRules" arg="$body.properties.placementRules" identifiers="key">
<prop type="array" name="protocolTypes" arg="$body.properties.protocolTypes">
<prop type="array" name="zones" arg="$body.zones">

<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="destinationReplications" identifiers="resourceId">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="dataStoreResourceId">
<prop type="array" name="rules" identifiers="ruleIndex">
<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="mountTargets" identifiers="fileSystemId">
<prop type="array" name="placementRules" identifiers="key">
<prop type="array" name="protocolTypes">
<prop type="array" name="zones">

command.name: update

help.short: The name of the NetApp account
The name of the capacity pool
The name of the volume
Backup Policy Resource ID
Backup Vault Resource ID
Policy Enforced
Resource tags.

Source of key used to encrypt data in volume. Applicable if NetApp account has encryption.keySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'. Possible values (case-insensitive) are: 'Microsoft.NetApp, Microsoft.KeyVault'
The resource ID of private endpoint for KeyVault. It must reside in the same VNET as the volume. Only applicable if encryptionKeySource = 'Microsoft.KeyVault'.

command.argGroup: <arg nullable="True" type="array" var="$body.properties.exportPolicy.rules" options="export-policy-rules rules" group="ExportPolicy">

<arg nullable="True" type="array" var="$body.properties.placementRules" options="placement-rules" group="Properties">
<arg nullable="True" type="array" var="$body.properties.protocolTypes" options="protocol-types" group="Properties">

help.short: Indicates whether the local volume is the source or destination for the Volume Replication
The remote region for the other end of the Volume Replication.

Has relocation been requested for this volume

<prop readOnly="True" type="array" name="destinationReplications" identifiers="resourceId">

<prop type="array" name="protocolTypes">
<prop type="array" name="zones">

help.short: The name of the NetApp account
The name of the capacity pool
The name of the volume
Order index
Allows CIFS protocol
Kerberos5 Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5 Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5i Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5i Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5p Read only access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Kerberos5p Read and write access. To be use with swagger version 2020-05-01 or later
Allows NFSv3 protocol. Enable only for NFSv3 type volumes
Allows NFSv4.1 protocol. Enable only for NFSv4.1 type volumes
Read only access
Read and write access
Client ingress specification as comma separated string with IPv4 CIDRs, IPv4 host addresses and host names

This parameter specifies who is authorized to change the ownership of a file. restricted - Only root user can change the ownership of the file. unrestricted - Non-root users can change ownership of files that they own.
Has root access to volume
